commentary.text: Dale Steyn walks out with intent, hands his cap to the umpire and is ready to bowl. One slip in place
Steyn to Simmons,no run,on target straightaway, pitches on length, some shape too, the batsman defends it to mid-on
Steyn to Simmons,no run,back of length delivery on off, the batsman defends it to cover point off the back foot
Steyn to Simmons,no run,he moves outside the leg stump and wants to hammer it over cover, but plays inside the line to be beaten
Steyn to Simmons,1 run,this one is one of those magic balls, pitches on middle and moves away, but it's full enough for Simmons to get a leading edge to extra cover
Steyn to Gautam,1 run,back of length delivery on the pads, easily tucked to midwicket for a single

nishanth: "for me...there are two kinds of batsman one,those who easily rotate strike and and bash the bowlers when they want and the others are those who can only capitalise during the powerplays and poor bowling......like shikar dhawan who plays excellent in powerplays always tends to slow down later and ends his innings for a lame shot"
Steyn to Simmons,no run,back of length on off, Simmons stands tall and punches it to cover
Srinivas Goud: "From Sachin Tendulkar & Sanath Jayasuriya opening to Simmons & Gautam! MI came a long way!"
Bhuvneshwar to start from the other end. He has been superb this season
Kumar to Gautam,no run,loud appeal for caught behind straightaway! This one is on a length and shapes away to beat the bat

Kumar to Gautam, $$OUT$$ ,doesn't wait too long to strike! Gautam charges down the pitch and punches the length delivery straight to Dhawan at mid-off, this came in after pitching, messing the batsman's timing
Kumar to Rayudu,1 run,good first ball to the new man! Seams away after pitching, squaring up the batsman and taking the outside edge to third man
Kumar to Simmons,no run,bowl the outswinger wide outside off, Simmons watches it go to the keeper
Kumar to Simmons,no run,this one comes in by a mile, hits the pads and everyone goes up - the fielders, the bowlers, the crowd - but the umpire rightly says it was heading down the leg side
Kumar to Simmons,no run,another inswinger, another time it strikes the pads, but Simmons had moved outside off this time
Steyn to Rayudu,1 run,superb outswinger again, the batsman slices it to backward point
Steyn to Simmons,no run,poor short! This one is an outswinger that Simmons tries to blast over mid-off without ever moving his feet, gets beaten

Jassi: "No doubt Bhuvi has been a different bowler this IPL and he has improved alot. But I don't see him having the same effect post-IPL as the in tandem Steyn will be missing from Indian squad to build up any pressure at all."
Steyn to Simmons,no run,peach of a delivery! Pitches on a length just outside off before darting away, past the outside edge
Steyn to Simmons,2 runs,charges down the pitch and flat-bats it without timing to mid-on, gets an extra run as the ball ricochets off the stumps
Steyn to Simmons,2 runs,moves his front leg out to drag the length delivery to deep midwicket, should have been three, but Simmons was slow thinking it was headed to the boundary
Steyn to Simmons,1 run,moves to the leg side to slog the short ball but only manages a top edge that lands safely at square leg. Not looking good, Simmons at the moment
Gopal: "Looking at Simmons play, I wonder who was the brains behind replacing Hussey with this guy! He's clueless against Steyn!"
CSK: "Every batsmen need to watch the video of AB taking apart Steyn and learn how to bat against the master bowler" ---- and also watch videos of every other good batsmen .. and work hard
Kumar to Simmons,1 run,short of length delivery, dragged to deep midwicket without any timing
Kumar to Rayudu, $$FOUR$$ ,that is a rocket! Rayudu comes forward and punches the ball down on the pitch, the ball just bounces over Bhuvi and races to the straight boundary
Kumar to Rayudu,no run,charges down the pitch early and gets a quick short ball, it sails past the helmet
Kumar to Rayudu,2 runs,not much swing this time, the batsman cracks it over point for a couple, Henriques got a hand to it at point to slow it down
Kumar to Rayudu,no run,length delivery on off, it's a slower one this time, the batsman comes forward and defends

Deep: "Gee whiz Bhuvi looks so good. Genuine display of swing either way. In an ideal world, Indian bowling attack for next few years would have Bhuvneshwar (backup PK) for swing, Shami for reverse and some pace (backup Yadav), Aaron for genuine pace (provided his radar is right) and Ishant for bounce (provided a everything else is right). And Vinay Kumar and Ashok Dinda must spend the rest of their lives playing domestic cricket."
Kumar to Rayudu,no run,that takes off from a length, the batsman is surprised by the bounce as he defends it to off
Irfan Pathan comes in to swing it
Pathan to Simmons,no run,back of length delivery on the stumps, Simmons punches it to cover off the back foot
Pathan to Simmons, $$SIX$$ ,that is the pace to hit! Simmons moves to the leg side, Pathan's swing follows him, but at 128 kph, it's easy for Simmons to whack over deep midwicket
Pathan to Simmons, $$FOUR$$ ,fuller now, Simmons moves his front leg out and murders past the mid-off, the fielder doesn't try to get in the way
Pathan to Simmons,no run,corrects the length this time, the batsman punches this straight delivery to cover
Pathan to Simmons,no run
Pathan to Simmons, $$SIX$$ ,there is a fielder at long-on but his leap won't do much! Simmons charges down the pitch and whacks the length ball straight over the boundary

Rama: "Jassi brings up a good point. Would it be then fair to say that Philander has benefited because of Steyn (as well as Morkel)? Philander has taken most of his wickets in pace/swing friendly conditions, wonder how he would fare in subcontinent conditions. "
Kumar to Rayudu,2 runs,back of length on the body, the batsman tucks it to square leg
Kumar to Rayudu,no run,slightly inswing in this one, the batsman comes forward and defends it solidly
amit: "Dear Bhuvi - take a long look at Irfan. Please don't go that way. Stay quick, stay fit, fulfil your potential."
Kumar to Rayudu,1 run,back of length delivery, easily nudged to midwicket for a single
Kumar to Simmons,no run,squares up the batsman as this one seams away from back of length, defended towards point
Kumar to Simmons,1 run,moves outside leg to blast this through off, but doesn't get the timing, hits it to mid-off for a single
Kumar to Rayudu,2 runs,back of length delivery outside off, Rayudu smartly nudges it to the right of third man and calls for a second one early
Mishra comes in now
Mishra to Simmons,1 run,absolutely clobbered down the ground! He clears his front leg and keeps hitting them straight, Rahul prevents the boundary
Mishra to Rayudu, $$SIX$$ ,now Rayudu  climbs into Mishra! Charges down the pitch and lifts it straight to the sight screen, effortless hit
Mishra to Rayudu,2 runs,flatter delivery, it is nudged to wide long-on with soft hands and they get back for the second

cris: "I find this whole Bhuvi worship a bit OTT. For the first 2-3 years of his career, Irfan was a very good new ball bowler. Even now, his ODI bowling record looks decent. Compare with Bhuvneshwar who's averaging 37 in ODIs. Bhuvi is an economical bowler but struggles to take wickets when the batsmen are not attacking him."
Mishra to Rayudu,no run,flatter again, Rayudu chops it straight to short third man
Mishra to Rayudu,1 run,he is not tossing it up anymore! on the pads and it's easily worked to deep midwicket
Mishra to Simmons,no run,big spin this time! Simmons was looking to cut but gets surprised with the turn and bounce, so does the keeper
Karn Sharma now
Sharma to Rayudu,1 run,tosses it up full on off, the batsman gets an inside edge to midwicket

Bez: "Of course Philander and Bhuvi have benefited from bowling with Steyn. But you have to have the skill to take advantage. Bowlers who can do something different and do it really well - like bowl a great line and length and move the ball both ways, as Philander and Bhuvi do - will always benefit from the pressure and fear Steyn builds up on the other end."
Sharma to Simmons,no run,it's the quick skidder now, the batsman looks to cut and is beaten
Sharma to Simmons,no run,comes down the pitch and looks to defend as he is not close to the ball

Aditya: "@cris - by that estimate, agarkar still remains one of our best in ODIs... truly a wicket taking bowler, and possibly the only Indian bowler who was not afraid to slip in a bouncer... yes, he went at 5+ per over, but compared to ishant or irfan or bhuvaneswar, he still would have been a reasonable choice for us..."
Sharma to Simmons,1 run,this is the googly, the batsman looks to defend but gets an inside edge to midwicket
Sharma to Rayudu,no run,some extra bounce for Karn! Rayudu punches it all the way back to the bowler almost
Sharma to Rayudu,1 run,tossed up on the middle, driven to long on for a single

mrbean: "The match result will come down to this: will Amit Mishra bowl to Pollard or not. Contrary to how everyone one would feel, I think Mishra getting Pollard would seal the match for sunrisers. I wont bet on it though"
Mishra to Rayudu,1 run,flatter and quicker, pushed to midwicket for a single
Mishra to Simmons,1 run,comes down the pitch early and looks to drive it inside out, but hello hello, it's the googles.. he gets an inside edge to long on
Mishra to Rayudu,1 run,comes out of the crease and flicks the fuller delivery to deep midwicket
Mishra to Simmons, $$SIX$$ ,lots of air from the bowler, more air from the batsman as he clears his front leg and hammers it over long on
Mishra to Simmons,no run
Mishra to Simmons,2 runs,filthy long hop, Simmons fails to take advantage of it as he pulls, but manages to put it in the gap at deep midwicket for a couple
Sharma to Rayudu,no run,flatter and quicker, Rayudu cuts it straight to short third man
Sharma to Rayudu,1 run,flatter again, Rayudu was out of the crease but punches it nicely to long off
Sharma to Simmons,2 runs,quicker delivery that cramps the batsman for room, Simmons punches it to deep extra cover for a couple, the throw from the deep was weak

Sharma to Simmons, $$FOUR$$ ,that has been dragged to the boundary! It was a good ball, nothing wrong with it, but he moves to the leg side and swings his bat across the line to find the wide long on boundary
Sharma to Simmons,no run,comes out of the crease but defends this one
Sharma to Simmons, $$SIX$$ ,long hop! goes a long way.. Simmons is finding some decent range here. Pulled over deep midwicket with ease
Rohan: "Question remains for Dhawan...who's quota he should complete, Irfan Pathan's or Amit Mishra's!"
Henriques comes in now
Henriques to Rayudu,no run,takes the pace off the delivery, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
Henriques to Rayudu, $$FOUR$$ ,happy boundary for Rayudu! He came down the pitch early and looks to flog this short ball, but gets a  thick inside edge past the keeper
Henriques to Rayudu,no run,slower again, the batsman pushes it down the pitch and Henriques dives to his left to parry it to cover
Henriques to Rayudu,no run,length delivery swinging away at a normal pace, the batsman pushes it to cover

Abhi: "Not questioning Hussey's credentials, but with the form he's in, Simmons was a good choice, he struggled initially, but once he got settled, he's getting some valuable runs here.. Huss would have been out by now based on his form." --- Hindsight makes us all looks so smart
Henriques to Rayudu,1 run,back of length delivery on off, chopped straight to point
Piyush: "In reply to the comment as to "who was the brains behind bringing Simmons instead of Hussey?" Looks like Simmons is making Gopal eat his words :D"

Henriques to Simmons,no run,he almost falls backwards trying to play that cut.. Simmons tries to make room and loses his balance, tries to play a cut but he was always falling away from the ball, is beaten
He's back.. Pathan
Pathan to Rayudu,1 run,slower ball outside off, Rayudu looks to hit it towards off but gets an inside edge that takes it to long on
Pathan to Simmons,no run,another slower delivery, the batsman cuts it straight to point
Pathan to Simmons,1 run,fuller outside off, Simmons goes down on his knees and drags it to deep midwicket
Pathan to Rayudu, $$FOUR$$ ,this is poor! slower delivery and it's too short, easy for Rayudu to pull it to deep midwicket boundary
Pathan to Rayudu, $$SIX$$ ,even better this time! Rayudu comes down the pitch now and lifts the length delivery over long-off with utter ease.. Baroda batsman going after his teammate
Pathan to Rayudu,1 run,length delivery wide of off, punched to wide long off for a single
paul: "Thanks to Irfan .... Simmons is getting good support !"

Riddymon: "Wondering why Sunrisers won't take a chance with bowling talent Jason Holder who is sitting on the bench. He's quickly filled the roll of a spearhead bowler for West Indies and shown that he's got good movement and control at pace. With someone like Mishra struggling he would be a good option or maybe even a replacement for Irfan Pathan. The same can be said for Santokie warming the bench for mumbai"
Steyn comes back

Andrew: "Irfan Pathan - future Indian captain to powder keg in the space of five years. Has any cricketer (for non-fixing reasons) fallen so fast?" --- who's says his stocks have fallen? He is still one of the most popular ones in India
Steyn to Rayudu, $$FOUR$$ ,length delivery wide of off, this is smartly done by the batsman, he steers it very very fine.. just past the keeper

Steyn to Rayudu,1 run,fires it full on the pads and Rayudu gets a leading edge to mid-off, Rayudu charges in, Henriques takes down the stumps from mid-off.. but he has come in.. almost runs in half-way down the boundary with his momentum
Steyn to Simmons,2 runs,not the best of pulls but it gives him two runs.. He has got fifty! fifty!! Long way from how he started the innings
Steyn to Simmons,no run,quicker short ball outside off, 144.5 kph, the batsman sways away from it
Steyn to Simmons, $$FOUR$$ ,it's on the pads and the batsman whips it in the air over backward square leg.. He is not in control of that, but this one runs down to the boundary
Steyn to Simmons,1 run,he is growing in confidence, punches this length delivery firmly down to long off

rssampat: "Any team which has the Likes of Dinda, I.Pathan, V.Aaron, Ishant Sharma in the playing eleven and expected to bowl 4 over's cannot even defend 400 off 20 over's on a dug up minefield of a dirt track. They will still manage to bowl 6 full tosses an over making the pitch reduntant!!!" --- Yes, that is India.. reminds me of an ODI in Bangalore last year
Mishra is back. Hello, it's Rayudu taking strike. Simmons scored a single the last ball of the over...
Mishra to Rayudu,1 run,flatter again, he is just not tossing it up, punches it to long on
Mishra to Simmons, $$FOUR$$ ,that was not too far from point! the batsman slices it for a boundary

Mishra to Simmons,1 run,oh no Rahul! You had all the time. Massive top edge that sails between deep midwicket and long-on. They look at each other but Rahul decides to go for it.. too late, the ball is already on the floor
Mishra to Rayudu, $$FOUR$$ ,that's salt on injury! Rayudu comes out of the crease and creams it over cover
Mishra to Rayudu,1 run,tossed up delivery, Rayudu takes it on the full and slaps it to long on
Mishra to Simmons,1 run,now Simmons comes out of the crease and drives this one easily to long on.. Another fruitful over for Mumbai
chandrahasa: "i guess yuvraj and rayudu follows cricinfo regularly, they saw the poll put on whether biggest they are biggest disappointments and are really doing well"
Henriques is here
Henriques to Simmons,1 run,he is powering them along this Simmons! Comes out of the crease and whacks the short of length ball to deep midwicket
Round the wicket
Henriques to Rayudu, $$FOUR$$ ,no stopping Mumbai! Henriques gives the batsman some angle and Rayudu slices it over point for another boundary
Henriques to Rayudu,1 run,on the pads, easily flicked to deep square leg
Henriques to Simmons,1 run,that is one powerful cut by Simmons, luckily there is a fielder in the deep for that shot
Henriques to Rayudu,no run,slower bouncer, the batsman looks to play an upper cut but doesn't manage any contact
Henriques to Rayudu,1 run,length delivery on off, the batsman throws his bat and gets an inside edge to single
Brad: "I understand that Hussey isnt in good form but surely there is a way to get him back in the side? "
Bhuvi comes in
Kumar to Rayudu,1 run,slower ball but down the leg side, flicked down to fine leg for a single
Kumar to Simmons,1 run,looks for the yorker but this is a low full toss that is punched down to long on
Kumar to Rayudu,1 run,length delivery on off, punched to long off for a single

Ketan: "Did I here the commentators saying that David Hussey has joined CSK??? ESPNCricinfo please reply " ---- I know I know.. we heard that too.. for the first time..It does look like  $$David$$ $$Hussey$$ $$is$$ $$in$$ $$CSK$$ $$now..$$
Kumar to Simmons, $$FOUR$$ ,No Rahul! He looses it again.. This was pulled powerfully to deep midwicket, bounces just ahead of Rahul who just overruns and looses the ball.. Steyn is not impressed
Kumar to Simmons, $$OUT$$ ,perfect yorker from Bhuvi! Simmons doesn't help his case by exposing his stumps as he looks for the ramp shot, it takes out the off stick
Rohit Sharma is the next man
Kumar to Sharma,no run,short ball to start with, Rohit doesn't feel the need to touch it
Saurav Bhattach: "These new generation of Rahuls are really maligning the name...."
Henriques to Rayudu,1 wide,length ball down the leg side, nothing going right for them here
Henriques to Rayudu, $$FOUR$$ ,no stopping Rayudu! It's a slower delivery outside off and the batsman drags it to wide long on
Henriques to Rayudu,1 wide,another one down the leg side, another wide
Henriques to Rayudu,1 run,back of length delivery on pads, the batsman flicks it to deep square leg
Henriques to Sharma,1 run,fuller delivery on the stumps, eased to midwicket for a single
Henriques to Rayudu,no run,slower delivery, very very slow delivery, it's at a snail's pace, slower than a koala, outside off and the batsman misses
Henriques to Rayudu,1 wide,quicker delivery, he pounds it on his own half and that sails way over the batsman
This is a long long over
Henriques to Rayudu, $$OUT$$ ,what reflexes from Henriques! That was short and was flat-batted back to the bowler, who stuck out his hands over his head and caught it in the second attempt.
Pollard coming in now.. This is the ninth ball in this over
Henriques to Pollard,1 run,he dabs it to mid-off and shoots off for a quick single
alan: ""david hussey in chennai!!!!. an already strong team made even stronger and experienced by his addition. really smart move made by chennai " "
Steyn comes back. 18 balls, 16 runs.. One slip
Steyn to Pollard,no run,can't get it away, pushes it straight to point
Steyn to Pollard,no run,superb delivery at this stage! Corker really, pitches on a length and flies past the outside edge, bowled it cross-seamed
Steyn to Pollard,no run,crazy crazy! Pollard dabs it to cover and takes off, just gets back in time
Abhi: "Can Mumbai Pull a Knight Rider here??"
Steyn to Pollard,1 run,short of length ball, this time he gets to the other end with a nudge to cover point
Amit: "This is one of the easiest jobs left to do for Rohit and Pollard.. Otherwise most of the time they are chasing run rate well above ten an over.. this is sort of unknown territory for both.."
Steyn to Sharma, $$FOUR$$ ,apologies for saying this - lazy elegance - but that's what it is. Just a defensive push through extra cover and it speeds up after it crosses infield
Steyn to Sharma, $$FOUR$$ ,more of that! It's a short delivery on the hips and Rohit whips it fine on the the leg side for another one

vb: "D Hussey for CSK??!! But that doesn't make sense !! He is a good lower middle order batsman and bowls a decent spin, both of which are not needed for CSK at this moment. I thought a bowling all rounder would have been a better fit, no?" ---- The big teams love big names in their bench
Karn Sharma comes in.. last over most likely
Sharma to Pollard,3 runs,premediated! He goes down on his knee early and laps it over the keeper's head.. not to the leg side, just over the keeper's head.. straight
Sharma to Sharma,1 run,flatter delivery on the pads, eased to deep square leg for a single

Ajit: "Steyn has got to be the most overhyped bowler in IPL. Just tell me how many times he has got the job done in a crunch situation!! In fact, he's the one who gives away easy runs at a crucial point with all his pace!"
Sharma to Pollard,1 run,they are in no hurry, a single to deep midwicket
Sharma to Sharma, $$FOUR$$ ,sweep end the chase, easily finds the boundary at square leg

The way they win some of these matches makes you wonder what are they doing at the bottom of the table. Simmons, after looking uncomfortable, powered the chase in the company of Rayudu, both attacking the Sunrisers spinners and making this one of their easier wins. Only five wickets went down in the day, not sure if that was a fair reflection of the pitch. Anyway, Mumbai keep their chances alive and stay in the race (they are still lagging behind but are not out of it).

"It was a perfect game, most clinical performance put by us,"  $$Rohit$$ $$Sharma$$  says. "This is our capability and we always expect this performance. We bowled well to restrict them and to chase it down like that, it was simply superb. To bowl at Warner and Finch that well is not easy, I must credit all the bowlers.  Today was a perfect day, Simmons smacked it right from the beginning and Rayudu kept it solid."

$$Rayudu$$ $$is$$ $$the$$ $$Man$$ $$of$$ $$the$$ $$Match$$ . He says, "My head was in UAE, my legs were in Hyderabad and my bat was somewhere else. It was all going haywire, so I had to get it all together .. Simmons took a lot of pressure on me, i could go and play all my shots."
Simmons get an award for hitting the most sixes, Moises Henriques gets an award for staying calm.

"We are not used to losing much here,"  $$Dhawan$$  says with a smile. "This was a new track here and we were not sure of how it would play. We were probably 20 runs short her. 157 was not bad but they batted well."

"We would have happened for this to happen a lot earlier," says  $$Pollard$$ . "We didn't start the tournament well and even the last game, we lost. The pressure to do well is always there. If you see the trend in IPL, defending champions don't do well barring CSK. We have to win, each and every day we have to dive around, run around and do our best to try and make it for playoff."
Thanks for your comments and feedback. Devashish Fuloria signing off. Ciao ciao.
Sarvan: "Lucky number 68 today ? All the 3 top scores for the day"
